title: What are the advantages of death? - Quora

response.answer_text: I like this question. I will share with you what I think is true. Can’t prove anything one way or the other. A functional human is made up of two parts, the hardware shell (the body) and the operating system [Windows/Mac/Linux] (the soul). The human doesn’t function properly without both. The soul can function all by itself without the body. When the soul is within the body and functioning as a human, the soul is limited to the functions of the body and the brain. In other words, a human is a dumbed down version of the soul. We don’t really die. The soul lives on, the body and brain dies. We define death when the body and brain dies. The good news is the soul lives on, forever. The soul is our true consciousness. The soul is a concentration of energy that is self-aware. We never lose this self-awareness. When we leave a non functioning body, we are met by our spiritual guide and some loved ones who have already passed into the afterlife. There is no pain or misery in the afterlife. We feel overwhelming love and see fantastic beauty. It’s a wonderful “state” and we prefer it over physical incarnations. Incarnating into physical hosts gives us the opportunity to learn what I call the six major life lessons. They are love, compassion, compersion, humility, forgiveness, and patience. In order to thoroughly learn these lessons, we must experience both the positive and negative aspects of these lessons. The positive sides are great, but the negative sides can be quite painful. This explains a lot of the pain people suffer through life. The other pain people feel is karmic paybacks. We must feel the pain that we cause others. If I cause pain to another, I must feel that pain, in return, to balance it out. This process is commonly known as negative karma or paying off karmic debts. For me, I will hold on to my physical life here as long as I can. I still have more to do here, and much more that I can learn in this life. I also know the afterlife will be great and it will be a really nice break between physical incarnations. Eventually, I will get to the point where it won’t be necessary for me to incarnate into physical hosts any longer, and I can enjoy the afterlife, permanently.
